title: Mechanical Engineer - Structural Design
description:
About Us

Based on our core value of "Empathy," we seek to automate "hard," "dirty," and "dangerous" jobs to realize a society where people can engage in more intelligent and creative work. We develop robotics platforms and solutions utilizing world-class control and artificial intelligence technologies. With over 10 billion yen raised and a multinational team of 200+ members from 30 countries, we are driving the robotics revolution across Japan, India, and the United States.

 

Job Responsibilities

We are seeking ambitious engineers to design and develop the robots and structures for automated warehouses, creating high-value solutions for our customers.

Design & Development: Create robots and structures meeting performance requirements for strength, load-bearing, and distortion.
Plastic Engineering: Determine molding methods, structural design, and flow analysis for plastic parts; provide advice on mold design.
CAD & Analysis: Create 3D models, assembly drawings, part drawings, and perform tolerance stackup analysis.
Validation: Prototype verification and validation in collaboration with the QA team.
Mass Production: Develop mass-produced products considering reliability, maintainability, and life cycle costs.
Collaboration: Liaise with external designers, suppliers, and manufacturers to ensure project success.

 

Requirements

Minimum Qualifications

Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering (or equivalent professional experience).
Experience: 3+ years in product development focused on electromechanical automation (Automotive, Aerospace, or Robotics preferred).
Technical Knowledge: Familiarity with Polymer Chemistry, Structural Engineering, and Mechanics of Materials.
Soft Skills: Independent worker with a team-oriented mindset, results-oriented, and high attention to detail.
Language: Business-level English proficiency.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience using Solidworks or equivalent CAD/FEA software.
Experience in resin molding and mass production design/start-up.
Knowledge of architectural design.
Experience developing mechanical systems specifically using plastics.

 

Benefits

Compensation: Attractive salary levels and Stock Options.
Environment: A truly global work environment with over 30 nationalities represented.
Talent: Work alongside excellent engineers and engage with cutting-edge technology daily.

title: Founding Designer
description:
About Us

Kamikai Labs is reimagining the future of 2D animation. Through our AI-powered suite of production tools, we help the world's leading animation studios and indie creators ship higher-quality work faster than ever before. Our products are already in active use across top-tier Japanese studios, and we're growing quickly as demand accelerates.

 

About the Role

We are seeking a Founding Designer to own our product experience end-to-end. This is a high-autonomy role where you will define how professional animators interact with AI-powered creative tools. You will work at the intersection of AI research and creative production, shaping how technology enhances human artistry.

 

Key Responsibilities

Full-Cycle Design: Own the entire product design process from initial research and wireframes to high-fidelity prototypes and visual polish.
Design System: Define and evolve a scalable design system to ensure consistency and speed across the product suite.
User Research: Conduct deep-dive research with animators and studio professionals to understand complex creative workflows.
Engineering Collaboration: Work closely with engineers and ML researchers to ship production-ready, professional-grade interfaces.
Culture Building: Shape the design culture, standards, and processes as the team expands.

 

Requirements

Experience: Senior-level product design experience (strong mid-level with creative tools experience considered).
Portfolio: A portfolio demonstrating end-to-end UX work on complex software or professional-grade tools.
Tools: Mastery of Figma and experience building/maintaining design systems.
Autonomy: Ability to take full ownership, move quickly, and make pragmatic tradeoffs in a startup environment.
Location: Based in Japan or willing to relocate (relocation support provided).
Language: English fluency is required; Japanese is a bonus.

 

Bonus Qualifications

Background in animation, illustration, or VFX production workflows.
Experience designing AI-powered or generative tools (e.g., handling model parameters, latent space, or iterative AI prompting).
Familiarity with the anime/manga industry.
Front-end development skills or advanced motion design/prototyping.

 

Why Join Kamikai?

Day One Impact: Shape the design DNA of a company transforming a global creative industry.
Elite Users: Build tools used by world-class animation studios.
Growth & Equity: Competitive compensation, relocation support, and a meaningful equity package.
Creative Team: Work with a passionate, technical team dedicated to human-centric AI.

 

Note for Applicants: When applying, please write only 1-3 bullet points about why you are an excellent fit for this specific role.

title: Ecommerce Product Manager
description:
About The Company

OWNDAYS (part of Lenskart) is a leading eyewear company that offers a wide range of high-quality spectacles to customers worldwide. Established in Tokyo, Japan in 1989, the company has grown to over 500 stores in 13 countries worldwide and has become one of the most trusted and innovative eyewear brands in many parts of the world. The company's success is a testament to its commitment to quality, innovation, and customer satisfaction.

 

Company Mission

Our mission goes beyond just providing clear vision; we aim to enrich our customers' lives by offering glasses that enhance their daily experiences. Committed to exploring new demands and services from Japan to the world, OWNDAYS continuously takes on the challenge of innovation. We are committed to providing customers with the highest quality products at the most affordable prices. With over 1,500 styles of frames available in-store and online, customers can choose from a vast selection of designs to suit their unique style and personality.

 

About The Role

We are looking for a  Ecommerce Product Manager (Junior–Mid level) to support the planning, coordination, and execution of campaigns and product launches across OWNDAYS’ online properties. This role sits at the intersection of marketing, merchandising, design, and development, and is responsible for ensuring requirements are clearly consolidated, timelines are managed, and releases happen smoothly and on time across regions.

This is a hands-on coordination and delivery role, ideal for someone who has experience managing web projects or campaigns and wants to grow into a broader online leadership position.

Native or fluent in Japanese (N1) and conversational English is a must.

 

What your responsibilities will be

Own the end-to-end online/web release timeline for campaigns, promotions, and new product launches across multiple regions
Work closely with global merchandising, branding, marketing, retail, design, and development teams to gather and consolidate requirements
Translate campaign and business requirements into clear deliverables and execution plans
Coordinate schedules, dependencies, and approvals to ensure on-time publishing across all online properties
Act as the main point of contact for online-related execution during campaign planning and launch phases
Ensure content, visuals, pricing, and promotional mechanics are accurately reflected on site at launch
Identify risks to timelines early and proactively propose solutions or adjustments
Support post-launch checks and issue management to ensure stable performance
Help improve internal processes, documentation, and workflows related to web releases and campaign execution

 

Minimum Qualifications:

2–5 years of experience in web operations, web project management, digital marketing, or e-commerce
Experience with SEO and working with Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics
Experience working with cross-functional teams (marketing, design, development, merchandising, etc.)
Strong organizational and timeline management skills, with attention to detail
Basic understanding of website structures, CMS workflows, and digital production processes
Comfortable managing multiple initiatives in parallel across different stakeholders and regions
Clear communication skills in a professional business environment
Native-level Japanese required; conversational English is required.
Exposure to e-commerce platforms, CMS tools, or project management tools

 

Nice to Have:

Experience working in a global or multi-regional organization
Experience supporting product launches or large-scale campaigns
Interest in fashion, retail, or consumer brands

title: Engineer Manager, Platform Services (Fluent Japanese & English Required)
description:
Recruitment Background

CADDi is on a mission to "Unleash the potential of manufacturing."
Launched in 2022, "CADDi DRAWER" is a groundbreaking product that uses technologies such as machine learning to structure and link critical design data, considered vital in the manufacturing sector. This innovation transforms this data into valuable informational assets. Already, we have received significant adoption from leading domestic manufacturing companies and machining firms, growing at a pace far exceeding T2D3. In 2023, we expanded our sales efforts to international markets, including the United States, Thailand and Vietnam.

Our vision for the future is to replicate and consolidate manufacturing expertise through technology, extending beyond blueprints to achieve holistic optimization across departments and companies. We aspire to transform our customers' workstyles and cultures, ultimately driving a revolution in the entire manufacturing industry.
Over the next few years, we plan to globally deploy numerous new applications on our platform. Achieving this scale and speed of business expansion requires a foundational platform, robust infrastructure, and unparalleled reliability to support all these applications.

The CADDi Core Division is at the heart of ensuring that the products we continuously create deliver value globally, quickly and reliably. We are looking for an Engineering Manager to maximize the productivity of the development organization within the CADDi Core Division and lead its business growth.

 

Responsibilities

What is an Engineering Manager at CADDi?

Your mission is to maximize the results of the departments and groups you oversee.
Setting OKRs to chart the course forward and perform necessary management tasks by working backward from our desired future state.
The role of an EM is not rigidly defined; we believe the approach to achieving results should align with each individual's strengths. For example, some excel at empowering others to drive outcomes, while others lead design and policy decisions directly on the ground. The balance between technology management, project management, product management, and people management also varies depending on each EM's assigned domain and key focus areas.

This recruitment position is primarily for leading a team involved in application development and platform development. The team is composed of members from multiple countries and operates as a global team.

Setting and managing team goals aligned with business strategy and product vision.
Developing team members through 1-on-1 meetings, performance evaluations, and feedback sessions.
Driving recruitment initiatives and external communications to strengthen our engineering brand.
Designing organizational structures optimized for scaling the product and business.
Planning and implementing effective information-sharing processes to enhance productivity in a bilingual (Japanese and English) environment.
Identifying issues, proposing initiatives, and executing measures aimed at maximizing the value and effectiveness of the engineering organization.

 

About the position

You will be responsible for managing platform service development within the CADDi Core Division, which oversees the common infrastructure (including goal setting for your assigned domain and various management activities to achieve those goals).

The mission of the CADDi Core Division is to develop and expand platform services that bear responsibility for solving common technical challenges across applications, thereby driving the overall business growth of CADDi through the power of its technological foundation.

※ The following tasks are not handled by a single manager at once; responsibilities are divided based on assigned areas, current priorities, and individual strengths and preferences.

Promoting Platform Servitization: Planning, development, and operational policy management for foundational services independent of business logic
Advancing Platform Engineering: Developing and providing platforms and tools to enhance company-wide developer experience (DX)
Close collaboration with EMs and Product Managers in application development organizations
People Management for Development Teams: Recruitment, Development, Evaluation, Organizational Design, etc.
Formulation and Execution of Technical Strategy: Selecting appropriate technologies and optimizing infrastructure costs based on business phase and ROI

 

Examples of areas of responsibility

File Platform: Responsible for unifying file upload and download functionality required by multiple applications.
Workflow Engine: Responsible for providing the execution foundation to perform large-scale batch processing in a defined sequence.
Additionally, develops and provides foundational services to resolve technical challenges within applications.
If your interests or strengths lie closer to the application layer, you may also be assigned to manage the Reliability domain (which includes SRE, QA, and Product Security) within the application development organization.

Around 30% of our development team members come from various international backgrounds, including Asia, Europe, and North America. To build a thriving multicultural environment, some teams communicate primarily in English, and critical meetings are held bilingually in both Japanese and English.

As a manager, you’ll be responsible for leading diverse, multinational teams. Depending on your experience and organizational needs, you may manage one or multiple teams. The exact team(s) you’ll oversee will be decided based on your expertise and preferences discussed during interviews and will be presented during the offer stage.

Internal communication within teams is primarily in English, whereas communication across teams involves a mix of Japanese and English, but a high level of Japanese proficiency isn't necessary.

This role provides you with opportunities to tackle challenging problems alongside passionate colleagues, contribute to a product that’s reshaping industry structures and creating social impact, participate in scaling a global product and international engineering organization, and experience significant professional growth by working closely with experienced leaders, including former CTOs of publicly listed SaaS companies.

※ Based on your experience and preferences, you will be expected to manage either a single team or multiple teams immediately upon joining.

※ Alternatively, you may start by actively contributing hands-on for several months to deepen your technical understanding, build relationships with stakeholders, and gradually transition into management duties.

※ Regarding your initial responsibilities:
We will propose your assigned area during the offer discussion, referencing the preferences and strengths discussed during the casual meeting and interviews.
We also look forward to discussing the details of each organization during the casual meeting.

 

About development organization

Our team includes top-tier technical leaders in Japan, such as CTO Kobashi, ex-Apple US Headquarters, and VPoE Fujikura, former CTO of Sansan.
We are tackling an unprecedented mission: fundamentally transforming an entire industry. That's why we've cultivated a culture that embraces the unfinished and challenges the unimaginable future. We prioritize unlocking individual potential, inspiring each other to build a development organization that delivers greater value to customers faster, and collectively create a world-class development platform to support it.

 

The appeal of this position and the experience you'll gain

Drive business growth with technology, leveraging unparalleled impact.
The unique thrill of this role lies in directly impacting business growth by driving productivity across multiple products and a developer team set to expand to hundreds. The enhanced developer experience and reliability you lead will accelerate CADDi's overall growth.
Challenge yourself with a modern platform tightly integrated with the business
To meet the demands of a rapidly growing global business, you'll constantly pursue a modern, scalable tech stack. Gain rare experience introducing and practicing world-class practices like Platform Engineering, SRE, and FinOps while directly feeling the business impact.
Diverse Business Phases and Flexible Career Paths
To launch numerous upcoming products, you'll tackle technical challenges across all phases—from building flexible foundations supporting “0→1” launches to enhancing reliability for scaling “10→100”. While deepening expertise in foundational domains, you can also envision a future career leading larger organizations.
Challenge in a Global Development Structure
As our business globalizes, our development organization is diversifying. You'll gain dynamic experience building and operating infrastructure across multiple regions, and creating a world-class platform alongside developers from around the globe.

 

Requirements

Experience demonstrating leadership as a manager in an engineering organization developing in-house products, directly contributing to business outcomes.
Experience in people management within an engineering organization (recruitment, evaluation, development, organizational design, etc.).
Experience in design, build, and operations experience as a platform engineer, backend engineer, or cloud infrastructure engineer.
Fluent business communication skills in Japanese. (Ability to conduct daily work entirely in Japanese, including written communication and meetings.)
Business-level English proficiency

 

Nice to haves

Experience developing large-scale file upload/download functionality
Experience developing execution platforms for large-scale batch processing
Experience designing and operating large-scale web services (high traffic, high availability)
Experience building and operating application platforms in Kubernetes environments
Experience designing and building architectures on public clouds (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)
Experience driving Platform Engineering and enhancing developer experience
Experience within rapidly scaling businesses and development organizations
Experience managing teams composed of multinational members.
Management experience in rapidly growing organizations or startups.

 

We want to work with individuals who have this kind of mindset

Individuals who understand our mission "Unleash the potential of manufacturing".
Individuals who can confront essential challenges and take action with a sense of ownership to resolve them.
Individuals who can perform their duties with a positive attitude and constructive discussions in fast-changing and highly uncertain situations.
Individuals who can communicate and discuss with a respectful attitude, considering the context and resolution of others.

 

Development Environment

Frontend: TypeScript,React,Next.js
Backend: Rust(axum),TypeScript,Node.js(Express,Fastify,NestJS)
Machine Learning・Algorithm: Rust,Python,OpenCV,PyTorch,TorchServe,Elasticsearch,Vertex AI
Infrastructure: Google Cloud,Google Kubernetes Engine,Anthos Service Mesh,Istio,Cloudflare,Argo Workflows
Event Bus: Cloud Pub/Sub
DevOps: GitHub,GitHub Actions,ArgoCD,Kustomize,Helm,Terraform,Datadog,MixPanel,Sentry
Data: CloudSQL(PostgreSQL),AlloyDB,BigQuery,dbt,trocco
API: GraphQL,REST,gRPC
Authentication: Auth0
Other tools: GitHub Copilot,Figma,Storybook
Communication: Slack,Discord,JIRA,Miro,Confluence

 

Salary Package

Initial annual salary is estimated to be in the range of 10 million to 14 million yen.
Salary reviews will be conducted twice a year.
The annual salary will be divided into 12 equal monthly payments.
Stock option program available.

 

Selection Process

Document screening
Coding test
This test aims to assess the logical thinking ability and minimum coding proficiency required for a Manager within our technical organization. For more details, please refer to here(https://recruit.caddi.tech/codingtest-english).
1st interview (Engineering Manager)
Based on your past experiences, we would like to ask mainly about the initiatives you have undertaken and the results you have achieved.
This interview will be conducted in Japanese.
HR interview
This stage does not involve selection criteria; it serves as an opportunity to align on conditions and clarify any questions regarding the selection process.
This interview will be conducted in Japanese.
2nd interview (VP of Engineering)
You will be asked to work on a pre-assigned task, and we will have a discussion about it on the day of the interview.
This interview will be conducted in Japanese.
Final interview (CTO)
This interview will be conducted in English or Japanese.
Offer interview

*Please note that, depending on the situation, additional interviews or discussions may be proposed.

*If desired, we can arrange casual interviews with employees even during the selection process. Please feel free to consult with us.

*The average time from application to offer is about one month, but if you are in a hurry, please let us know. We will do our best to adjust the schedule to fit your job search timeline.

title: QA Lead (Global Product Team)
description:
Recruitment Background

At CADDi, our mission is to unleash the potential of manufacturing by delivering an AI-powered data platform for the industry. We are growing globally across Japan, the US, and ASEAN countries at a pace far exceeding the T2D3 benchmark. We are seeking a QA Lead to join our Incubation team to help shape our engineering organization as we move into a new stage of global growth.

 

About the Incubation Team

The Incubation team functions as an independent startup within CADDi. We focus on creating new applications on top of our core platform, CADDi Drawer, which manages archives of engineering drawings and supply-chain data. Our goal is to launch products that solve customer problems, build strong teams, and create structured ways to accelerate development.

 

Expected Role & Responsibilities

As a QA Lead Engineer, you will go beyond process improvement to address the strategic importance of quality. You will define quality standards based on product vision and foster trust with our customers.

Strategy: Defining desired quality based on product vision, business strategy, and organizational status.
System Building: Building a QA framework and system, including training and hiring QA members.
Planning: Formulating test strategies and leading test planning, design, and execution.
Collaboration: Reviewing product specifications and proposing improvements from a quality perspective.
Automation: Promoting both automated and manual testing across the software delivery life cycle (SDLC).

 

Requirements

Expertise: Proven experience leading QA activities and implementing processes in accordance with standards like ISTQB, ISO 29119, and general QA methodologies.
Language: Fluent business-level Japanese (JLPT N2 or equivalent, or ~3 years experience in a Japanese-speaking environment).
Leadership: Strong technical expertise and the ability to lead QA strategy in an Agile environment.

 

Development Environment

Frontend: TypeScript, React, Next.js
Backend: Rust (axum), TypeScript, Node.js
Infrastructure: Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Istio, Terraform
DevOps/Data: GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, Datadog, BigQuery, dbt
API: GraphQL, gRPC, REST

 

Working Environment & Salary

Salary: Estimated 9 million to 12 million yen (Stock option program available).
Location: Tokyo (Relocation support available).
Workplace: Hybrid (Recommendation to visit the office once a week; quarterly in-person kickoffs).
Hours: Flextime (Core time 11:00–16:00).

 

Interview Process

Application Review
Technical Writing Sample
1st Round Interview (Hiring Manager)
2nd Round Interview (Engineering Manager)
Final Round Interview (CTO/VPoE)
